# trackingArea

**Instance Property**

The tracking area for the event.

## Declaration

```swift
var trackingArea: NSTrackingArea? { get }
```

## Discussion

If you access this property on an event object that is not a mouse-tracking event — that is, its event type isn’t [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSMouseEntered], [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSMouseExited], or [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSCursorUpdate] —AppKit raises an [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSExceptionName/internalInconsistencyException].

If the event corresponds to a tracking rectangle installed with the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/addTrackingRect(_:owner:userData:assumeInside:)] method of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView], the value of this property is `nil`. The [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSEvent/trackingNumber] property contains either an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTrackingArea] object or [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/TrackingRectTag], depending on how AppKit generated the event.

## Getting tracking area information

- **eventNumber**: The counter value of the latest mouse or tracking-rectangle event object.
- **trackingNumber**: The identifier of a mouse-tracking event.
- **userData**: The data associated with a mouse-tracking event.
